page.title: 01Thinly Populated Arable Land
page.content: This is an intensely farmed flat area with scattered residences beside narrow roads, plus the small village of topcroft. Topcroft has about six hundred residents, one shop, and a church. The school has closed and there are now no pubs. The area is typical of rural Norfolk. The farming is nearly all arable with occasional small herds of cows or sheep. The residents are partly long established families once connected with farmwork with a growing number of skilled and professional people working in or around Norwich but preferring to live in the country. There is now little work in this area. The houses are mostly family homes, some as old as several hundred years, but converted to modern standards. There are a few new houses, most have
